content:
Life expectancy, or the average amount of time that a person is expected to live, has increased significantly over the past few centuries due to advances in medicine and improvements in living conditions. In the past, life expectancy was often much lower due to the high rates of infant mortality and the prevalence of diseases.

As far as the progression of human invention, there have been countless inventions throughout history that have had a major impact on society. Some examples of notable inventions include the wheel, the printing press, and the internet. These inventions have greatly improved our ability to communicate, transport goods, and access information. Overall, the progression of human invention has greatly enhanced our quality of life and has greatly increased our life expectancy.
